description:
'''Tropical house''', also known as '''trop house''', is a subgenre of [[house music]], and a derivation of [[tropical music]], with elements of [[dancehall]] and [[Balearic beat|Balearic house]]. Artists of the genre are often featured at various summer festivals such as [[Tomorrowland (festival)|Tomorrowland]]. The genre was popularized by artists including [[Kygo]], [[Thomas Jack]], [[Klangkarussell]], [[Klingande]], [[Robin Schulz]], [[Bakermat]], [[Matoma]], [[Lost Frequencies]], [[Felix Jaehn]], [[Seeb (music producers)|Seeb]] and [[Gryffin]]. Tropical house hits include Kygo's "[[Firestone (song)|Firestone]]", Klingande's "[[Jubel (song)|Jubel]]", Felix Jaehn's remix of "[[Cheerleader (Omi song)|Cheerleader]]", Robin Schulz's remixes of "[[Waves (Mr. Probz song)|Waves]]" and "[[Prayer in C]]", and Lost Frequencies's remix of "[[Are You With Me]]". 

The term "Tropical House" began as a joke by Australian producer Thomas Jack, but has since gone on to gain popularity among listeners. The term "trouse" should not be confused with tropical house, as "trouse" is a genre that instead combines the feeling of [[Trance music|trance]] and the beats of [[progressive house]], using electro synths.
